page.title: 08Thoughts of an Italian boy
page.content: My name is{Angelo Castaldo}and I am ten years old. I came{from Italy}three years ago when my father's job brought him here. When I arived I{spoke no English}and I did not make friends easily. I found it hard to settle until I had learned some English because I did not understand the lessons. Now I have many English friends and my teachers tell me that I never stop talking. This school is very small compared to my school in Rome. We only used to have one playtime a day whereas the children here have three each day.But the school work is much the same-too hard and lots of it. I would have liked to stay here another year and finish my primary schooling but my father returns to Rome this summer.Now I wonder if I shall remember Italian on my return.
